website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking to stop paying to rent a modem, this is a great option for a good price.
pros: Supports cable internet service plans up to 300 Mbps
Compatible with Xfinity from Comcast, Spectrum, Cox, CableONE, and more
cons: Not compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, or with voice-bundled plans

customer_reviews.title: Quick! Go somewhere else. Save your sanity.
customer_reviews.text: I feel very fortunate that this thing took a dump before 30 days expired. Netgear's support stands out in a terrible industry for their total uselessness. Anything would be better. Anything
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it if will be using with Comcast, This specific model has issues with Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t works well on comcast. it connects and reach communication with Comcast but after minutes it disconnects. Bunch of time lost calling Comcast, calling netgear and both blaming each other. A Comcast technician came to my house and after several testing and cable adjustment told modem was the problem, also told several other customers has problem with this specific model (not the brand). At the end I purchased another brand cable modem and works flawless. I recommend buying another higher model or even another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Trouble maintaining connection on Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: I chose this modem on the basis of The Wirecutter review despite having had a good run of luck with Motorola and Arris modems. The Netgear modem was pretty easy to connect to Xfinity. Connection to my Wifi router (ASUS RT-N66U) was a bit tricky and required multiple reboots of the modem and the router before it would finally connect. For the five days, everything seemed fine but after that initial period the modem started loosing it's cable signal and required 1-2 reboots per day. I have subsequently switched to the Motorola MB7621, The Wirecutter's alternate choice.
customer_reviews.author: Gilman Wong

customer_reviews.title: A warning to any modem buyer:
customer_reviews.text: According to Comcast, the modem I bought looked brand new, and in its original package, but it was registered to an account currently in use. And thus it cannot be used by anyone else. MAC addresses can not be reused. The 2nd one got here fast and works great. These simple modems are easy to set up and locked with a password and there is a big advantage to locking the modem separate from a router, I found out the hard way, as I got a bad network attack within hours through Comcast Modem/router to a.o. crunch bitcoin, etc. Malwarebytes, nor Norton have been no help...
customer_reviews.author: WalksDogsHerdsCats

customer_reviews.title: The best of the best
customer_reviews.text: I learned the hard way that Netgear is the best equipment on the market. I don't even look at the competition anymore. I install equipment for my family and friends so I have done a few. The CM600 is so easy to install it takes longer to get it out of the box than to install. It even connects itself with your internet provider. No more phone calls. The internet provider even does the firmware updates and no more equipment rental fees. If that isn't enough - it looks sweet and sleek. 1 year update - It just sits there and works and never slows down. Netgear all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Jerbear

customer_reviews.title: I have one phone line and it sounds amazing with this unit
customer_reviews.text: I have Comcast, when I plugging everything in it went VERY smooth! With Comcast it took about 45 minutes on the phone to switch everything over from my rental unit. I have one phone line and it sounds amazing with this unit. Not very technical in this area. Glad to take rental fee off my bill. Give this a try you will be thrilled!!!
customer_reviews.author: Go Blue

customer_reviews.title: A great value, and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem is inexpensive, compact, very easy to install, and does the job nicely! I didn't even have to talk to a person at my cable provider to switch. I just went to the Optimum Cablevision URL supplied with this replacement modem, entered the new modem's MAC address, and switched within minutes. No more paying a monthly rental fee to Optimum Cablevision (Altice). This cable modem doesn't have a built-in wireless router, but why pay extra for that? You can pick whatever wireless router meets your needs and connect it directly to this modem. A simple wireless router like Netis WF2419 would serve most households' needs and costs less than $15.
customer_reviews.author: xt56kxz84jg

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse and SAVING ME MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing. I am smoking what I was getting on my previous rental router. Granted I have this paired with the new Linksys WRT AC3200, but man I love this little guy. -Stays cool -Pulls hard (normally well over 100 mbps wirelessly (I WAS GETTING 20mbps)) -EASY set up Yes you do have to call comcast and give them the MAC ID. Totally worth it. Took me like 15 mins to set it up with my brand new router so I could ensure Wifi Signal all of the house house. AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: The Boss

customer_reviews.title: Must manually reset
customer_reviews.text: I hate the Netgear CM600. I bought it because of this review but I’ve had it for 9 months and it’s the worst modem. I always keep my modem and router on a timer so that it shuts down for 30 min at night to reset. However, the CM600 refuses to reset unless you manually push a pin in the reset hole. As a result, I now have to remember to manually reset my modem every few weeks. If you don’t mind manually resetting, it gets good speeds.
customer_reviews.author: L. Muljo

customer_reviews.title: Optimum Cable Subscribers Can Skip This One
customer_reviews.text: If you're an Optimum Cable (I guess formerly Cablevision) subscriber in the Metro NYC area, you can skip this modem. While it purports to be compatible; it is not. It will not support the telephony and Optimum could care less in helping you figure it out, "You'll have to call Netgear for that." I thought I'd still give it a go with just the interwebz and it is not compatible with my router either. Even though I have 300 MBPS speed it can't keep the handshake up between the modem to the WiFi router. Continual drops in service and everything is buffering. Ugh, too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amanaude

customer_reviews.title: Very good modem at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm extremely pleased with this modem. I used this to replace a CM500 that was 3+ years in-service and was giving signs of failing. After installation (very easy and quick), I immediately perceived an increase in speed on-line. Putting a meter on the internet didn't indicate a huge speed improvement, but quality of streaming and initial site download was very apparent. Could be my provider just got better overnight, but I'm pretty sure it has something to do with my new router. Very pleased and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased new in January of 2020 and paired with a Netgear router. We started getting intermittent service interruptions a month or so ago, but we had changed providers when we bought the modem and figured they just weren't as reliable. Then it hard died yesterday. I had to dig a 5 year old Arris out of the closet to get service and it worked fine aside from not being able to handle the speed we're paying for. I'll be going back to Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Works for up to 400mb/s if you need phone connection too
customer_reviews.text: The unit installed easily and works correctly on my 150mb/s Internet connection. I have been testing the download speeds over the last two months and they are consistent at 150 mb/s. If you don't need a phone connection, modems with more features or less expensive are available. This unit has no wifi. I have a Netgear Orbi wifi which works perfectly for wifi. Highly recommended if you have a two story home or large area to cover. Even thought Comcast recommends this until not all Xfinity app controls work with this model. The missing features do no affect the Internet connection or download speeds. If Xfinity app xtras are important check in advance as Comcast support is abysmal.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Should have done this long ago!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have Xfinity/Comcast. I was tired of paying the $13 modem rental fee so I bought this voice modem. I just set it up...took 5 minutes. No dreaded phone call to Comcast customer service...just followed prompts on the computer. No tech ability required! I wish I had done this long ago but I was afraid I’d create a mess that would be difficult to fix. Not so! $13 a month isn’t a huge savings but it helps! My triple play bill is $290 and I’m locked in until February. This modem will pay for itself in 10 months!
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 2 Cool Chicks (3/30/04)

customer_reviews.title: Pull the plug on Comcast modem rent!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got rid of Comcast's rental modem. The final straw was when I could not turn off the "Xfinity WiFi" signals, even though Comcast claimed they were disabled. My frequency analyzer proved otherwise; only the SSID was disabled... It's on Comcast's approved list, so getting it provisioned was easy (though be prepared for about a half hour on the phone with them to get it done). Throughput is at least as good as the Comcast modem, and my neighbors' WiFi channels aren't being clobbered by "Xfinity WiFi".
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Netgear CM600 modem
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this modem as part of a transition to customer-owned devices for Comcast Triple Play service. Worked with Tech Support for install/activation because we have split incoming coax to serve both a stand-alone Internet-only modem and an eMTA for digital voice-only. Up and running after ca. 20-min process, and the CM600 delivers at or above my Blast! Pro @ 250/10 rated speed tier. Operates on the warm side, but sited in an open environment. And so far, flawless performance, and can handle next speed tier upgrade to 400 mb/s. Has latest firmware rev., and I’m not sure whether that was pre-installed or pushed by CC after provisioning. Entirely satisfied, value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Lance Chrome

customer_reviews.title: Good Upgrade - worth the $
customer_reviews.text: I "cut the cable" and needed a good set up to watch Netflix, Hulu, on .... i had read an article about in order to get good Up and Down load speeds you should look at your modem, router, and cables. This modem has been great - delivering higher speeds than my internet company guaranteed. I did plug in many of the data hogs (Hulu/Netflix) and use the wifi part for phones and iPads but so far 2 months in i am very pleased with the purchase. Note my router was NETGEAR R6700 Nighthawk AC1750 Dual Band Smart WiFi Router, Gigabit Ethernet (R6700) and that was a great purchase as well.
customer_reviews.author: DMDItaly

customer_reviews.title: Decent...misleading Data
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, but I would recommend a better Modem. There were times where the lights blinked for no reason? maybe I got a faulty one. It is better than the Belkin one I had before, but it is not up to par as what the ratings from the other review has. I think there should be on-going test of these sorts of products to show performance... this "Up to" vs Actual speed is different.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Wang

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I knew my modem was holding back my internet, but the difference was amazing. I had a DOCIS 3.0 4x4 before and my download speeds were around 115mbps. Now I’m seeing over 400mbps. I pay for Cox Ultimate and I’m finally getting what I pay for. I gave it four stars instead of five because it’s physically huge compared to others which makes it more difficult to find a spot for it, but other than that it’s great so far.
customer_reviews.author: tmil

customer_reviews.title: i was never able to fully utilize those speeds because of my SB6120 (which was excellent for its era) but now im getting advertised speeds ...
customer_reviews.text: HUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUGE Difference compared to my previous sb6120 (which i had for 6 years) The NetGear CM600 is an absolute beast. MY ISP (Spectrum) offered me the 200MB/10MB UP package for a couple years, i was never able to fully utilize those speeds because of my SB6120 (which was excellent for its era) but now im getting advertised speeds and the netgear cm600 is even improving latency and ping as well. Hoping for another 6 years, just like the SB6120. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Himanshu Bhardwaj

customer_reviews.title: Good and affordable upgrade from the old modem
customer_reviews.text: My old Motorola SB6121 worked well (~25 Mbps) however recently I noticed the internet speed slowed down (~10Mbps). There was a nice promotion from Comcast, so I took a chance however the speed was not improved (it was supposed to be up to 50 Mbps). When I checked my account, I found my old modem was not good for my plan. It was time to get a new modem. I checked the modems from the modem list found from Comcast website one by one and found that this modem had good reputation and was affordable (some modems were very expensive ~$200). The installation was very easy. It worked well and now the download speed is 60~70 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Lost connection almost everyday with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: I use this modem for my Xfinity service. For the first 6 months or so, it worked fine. Then it started dropping connections. First I suspected cable service outage but always got confirmation that there was no issue from the service side. Rebooting modem may or may not help. Sometimes it takes several reboots. Sometimes it comes back by itself. I struggled with it for a few more months (not it has been 10months since purchase). It has gotten to the point that it drops connection several times a day, almost every day. It has to be replaced. I will be shopping for some other brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lu

customer_reviews.title: Landline Easily Replaced
customer_reviews.text: We recently eliminated our landline and went with Comcast Triple Play with phone service. My previous modem was no longer supported by Comcast anyway and wouldn't support the phone service, so we replaced it with this CM500V modem. Setup was a breeze and then the phone call to Comcast to have them set it up went flawlessly as well. Once all setup, we were able to disconnect the phone lines from the outside landline box, run a phone cable from the modem to the jack in the wall and just like that we had phone service on all our existing landline phones! Very satisfying install. I would definitely recommend this modem to anybody looking to replace their landline phone service.
customer_reviews.author: Travawing

customer_reviews.title: i PAID for a NEW one !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: UNACCEPTABLE! I RECEIVED USED MODEM ! when i PAID for a NEW one all cords are new in box, but the modem is looks like lts been kicked around a shop floor a few times. now i cant call support?? to send new one while if i can use this if it works? i just ordered new internet and cant update my speed cause of this!! wifes trying to use internet to do work.
customer_reviews.author: J. s.

customer_reviews.title: Fast, cheap, and in control
customer_reviews.text: Took barely 10 minutes to set up including reaching inside my cabinet to disentanlge the $13/month comcast modem, write down the MAC address and model #, call comcast, restart it and get it ticking. There is some disagreement about who supports firmware if it ever needs to get upgraded - comcast says they will not lift a finger if it needs upgrading, but it doesn’t seem to be user upgradable. So... I’ll cross that bridge when I get there. In the meantime, blazing fast speeds, super quick set-up, and no rental fees!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Runs HOT and lasts 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This modem runs hot... not just normal electronics hot, more like you could cook dinner on it. If you leave it horizontal, it will error in less than 24 hours due to overheating. If you unplug and plug back in, then it will work again. If you leave it vertical you can avoid the problem, but after 5 days vertical, it died, presumably the electronics inside melted due to the sun-like heat it produced. This modem is defective, save yourself the stress and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cressia

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this device because I thought it was a better deal than you can find at a retail store. The first one I ordered didn't work and Amazon allowed me to return it for a new one. The new one was shipped out very fast and customer service was very nice, however, the new device only worked for 2 months before it completely stopped working. I read some of the previous reviews and many of the stated that they had to keep unplugging the device in order for it to work. I took that advice and it worked for almost a week but I got tired of having to keep unplugging it multiple times a week.
customer_reviews.author: brinpe

customer_reviews.title: Will not be fast.
customer_reviews.text: Does not get advertised speed on Comcast xfinity. Ordered 400 service, could not get more than 75 from this, and according to the Comcast tech who came out to the house, any service from Comcast over 100 down will require a 32 channel 3.1 modem and therefore this modem will never get near that. On the phone Comcast will tell you this modem is supported for the rated speed and service level, but the tech said it will never happen. He verified all 16 channels were bound, so no problems with the modem hardware, it just can't get anywhere near the specified speed.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Used Router Sold as New. Unusable since it is still registered to another Comcast account.
customer_reviews.text: When I tried activating the router through Comcast I found out it was used and is still connected to another Comcast account. It was advertised as a new router. I will be buying a new router that I can use from a local retailer to ensure it's not associated with another account. Very disappointed and will be seeing if I can get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Super deal
customer_reviews.text: On Charter improved my speeds slightly, went from 120Mbps (Sb6120) to 135Mbps (CM600) after install. Ping also went from 34ms down to 7ms averaged over 3 runs. Bought more for maintaining speed than increasing speed at this time. So far bonded to 24 channels. Upstream shows 8 available but only 4 active in my area (St Louis). Self activation did not work, had to call Charter. Charter updated firmware overnight from V5 to V14. Stay away from modems with the Puma chip-sets, even with a patch they still have lag/ping issues.Web-sites load really fast on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Orr

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but trouble, poor customer support!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this cable modem on May 8th. As of July 15th it quit working properly. Will not stay connected and when it does connect after restarting it I get 3 -5 MBPS connection speed. This is unacceptable. After screwing around with this POS for two days I reinstalled an older cm400 I had. Much fsster connection speeds! I cannot recommend this modem at all. It's great while it works but it doesn't work for long. Didn't even last through the 90 day free customer support. Which by the way pretty much sucks as well.
customer_reviews.author: N. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Was baught for a really needed upgrade, been using an old modem for about 6 years and it was the time to upgrade to something that would take advantage of the new internet speeds being provided. Had some trouble setting it up myself, wasn't the devices fault but rather my internet providers. It's been up for almost 4 weeks now and my internet speeds are ayyyyy faster. Every now and then I would experience my internet shutting down tho, happened with my old router too. Not sure if I'm unlucky or if it's just my internet provider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cost effective replacement for Xfinity rental
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Xfinity/Comcast and is saving me > $13 per month; it will recoup the cost in less than a year. The modem is much newer than the one that it replaced and is getting the same or better speeds (I only have the basic tier). I had a little trouble connecting the phone, but that was the Xfinity support persons fault. Once corrected, phone worked flawlessly. One thing I like most is that Xfinity cannot screw with it like they can their own equipment and the configuration/settings are not exposed through their "app" (which does not sound like a desirable feature to me). I do not like having my data exposed like that.
customer_reviews.author: MBburg

customer_reviews.title: Worked with problems for 4 mos
customer_reviews.text: We had periodic problems with slowing internet and signal dropping and thought it was other issues until finally had our internet provider send out a tech. After checking outside, replacing some cable,etc. the issues persisted. He ran diagnostics on the modum and found the signal kept dropping out. He installed one of their modums and our speed shot up to a consistent level and we have had no problems since. The Netgear modum is still under warranty, but I have not tried to return it yet.
customer_reviews.author: dalidog

customer_reviews.title: Useless after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked well immediately when I bought it, and now as I am approaching 6 months the t3/t4 timeouts are non-stop. Can't watch or play anything without the signal absolutely degrading. Moved twice with it, no help from netgear, ISP obviously cant do anything on their end. Wish It started failing sooner so I could return it. Have tried literally everything (factory resetting, having multiple techs look at the lines, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J. Spence

customer_reviews.title: Net Gear is a solid, reliable modem.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this modem to replace the Net Gear cm400 I’ve had for several years. As time went on the number of devices using the net began overwhelming the cm400. Other than that, I would not have replaced that modem. It was a reliable modem all those years. Because of the integrity of that modem I decided to stay with Net Gear. Consequently, I purchased the Net Gear cm600 cable modem. I have this modem paired with a Net Gear R7000 Night Hawk Router. All the devices in my house now stay on line and do not get bumped off. The speed has increased as well. Very happy with this modem. I would definitely recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: billieg

customer_reviews.title: Gives me full 150mbps internet speed to my WiFi router
customer_reviews.text: I have a Comcast Xfinity 150mbps internet plan and this modem is perfect for delivering the full 150mbps speed to my AC router, which in turn gives me the full 150mbps to my cellphone, 4k TV, and other WiFi devices through a 5GHz 802.11ac signal. Very pleased that this modem has not given me any problems all year. My main problem right now is with my router which I will be replacing soon, but the modem is still doing its job. If you have a Gigabit internet plan, you will want to buy a modem rated to give 1.0 gpbs. Using this router for a Gigabit connection may only give you 1/3 of your potential speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle User

customer_reviews.title: So far works great, no issues and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I've bought modems before that worked great for awhile and then started to have issues so take this with a grain of salt. If it does start to require frequent restarts I'll update this review. Setup was easy, except it's recommended to connect a physical Ethernet cable to your computer when setting up so make sure you have one long enough laying around or pick one up for the job if there's a distance between your computer and modem. Our laptops don't have network ports so I needed a good 20 foot cable for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Artur Hawkwing

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Netgear
customer_reviews.text: I gave up on DSL internet and decided to move to cable. In the past I've used a combo modem/router but decided to go separate this time and chose a Netgear Nighthawk Router and this Netgear Modem. The modem was so easy to set up. I had everything ready to go and the installer was in and out quickly. We've had great speeds, no problems at all. I've always been happy with Netgear products and am happy to be back using Netgear. Highly recommend this modem.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Swapping rented modem with purchased modem
customer_reviews.text: Works well so far. I needed to work with cable company to initiate/active the modem so it could be used with my internet service. Please be aware this seems NOT to be a plug and play device. Either do to my own lack of knowledge or by intent, I needed to work with provider to get up and running. Also be aware this unit does not have a phone jack. This would only be a concern if I was going to keep my phone service. The 3 stars for technical support was only given since I have not had to reach out to tech support for any issues. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: M's review

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money don’t forget to activate with provider!
customer_reviews.text: Update- user error Was my issue, I should have called Comcast to activate it first! I had An existing netgear router and replaced the arris modem from Comcast/xfinity with this one and set it up the same way. I went Online and activatEd it and downloaded the stoftware....yet the connection still is a bust! I see the WiFi name And join but no iternet access! I called Netgear support and they said I had To purchase technical support....for the router even though the router is a non issue...not good free customer service like Alexa or Ecobee :/ I’ve now been on hold 10 min for them to “see what they can do”
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this modem for my new place and the Xfinity tech registered/activated it during the service call after he ran new cable from the telecom pedestal outside, no issues with compatibility for that service. Consistently getting higher than advertised speeds on a 400 down /25 up connection, should have no problem going up to 960 mbps but my subscription tops out at around 600 so I have not personally verified that.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Simple and cost saving!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item and was ready to spend the next 4 hours talking to Comcast and installing this modem. NOT THE CASE. Opened box, disconnected rented router/modem, connected this modem, logged on to comcast and activated it. All lights on and fully operational in less then 12 minutes. Returned the rented router to Comcast and saved $156 a year.
customer_reviews.author: Project Firestart

customer_reviews.title: Reliability and speed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem (cm600) with the nighthawk router and had it running for 3 weeks on Spectrum cable. It disconnected about 4 times and did not come back up. I called Spectrum and they sent a technician out to check the connection. He told me to try their modem which is no charge since Spectrum bought out Time Warner. What a difference in speed. If the connection stays on (which the technician says they have good success with) I will be a happy camper. Sent the CM600 back. It was slow and did not stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if just bad luck but doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Spent 5 hours total between Spectrum and Netgear and nothing worked - both tried everything under the sun but it couldn't get online. Spectrum activation services were surprisingly really easy to get a hold of and everyone I talked with seemed very knowledgeable and patient. Netgear tech support was absolutely worthless - it took 40 minutes of wait time even though I had signed up for their "Premium Support" service and then just did all the same things that Spectrum recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Ewen

customer_reviews.title: So far I am very happy with this modem and the choice of buying it
customer_reviews.text: I called Comcast to help me setup my CV500V modem which took about 20 minutes. After it was setup, I checked the speed and found it at least the same as my Comcast provided modem. Each day I check the speed several times and found no deviation in speed. So far I am very happy with this modem and the choice of buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robert L. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Did not deliver stated speed and support was terrible
customer_reviews.text: The Netgear CM500V (data and voice) fell far short of expectations. Comcast recently upgraded my internet service to 400 Mbs; they recommended this modem. Based on specs it seemed to be a perfect fit for my needs. However I could not get sustained bandwidth speeds. In speed tests, I would get an initial jump to 400 Mbs then a steady decline to about 150 Mbs. A Comcast technician could not find any issues with their service so I turned to Netgear support. My experience with Netgear support based on several calls has been terrible - long wait times to get connected and no useful assistance.
customer_reviews.author: SethS

customer_reviews.title: Works well for our WiFi needs.
customer_reviews.text: The NEATGEAR Cable Modem with Voice CM500V - For Xfinity by Comcast Internet & Voice works well in my home for my wifi needs. I do not use the voice feature so I cannot review that feature. The modem works well with my router. The two were easy to connect and I did not have to have technical support. This is a modem ONLY. Xfinity is our internet provider. WiFi is strong enough to cover my 1233 sq ft home. I am pleased with the results and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Old Coast Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I have Optimum 400 Mbps service and was getting at most 90 Mbps download speed with Optimum equipment. After swapping the Optimum WiFi router for Netgear Nighthawk X6, the speed jumped up to 160 Mbps. I was hoping to get further improvement with the Netgear modem. The modem was provisioned without issues by Optimum tech support (except for waiting on hold for 40 minutes). Initial download speed (on Ethernet connection) was 30 Mbps, dropping to less than 5 within minutes. Rebooting the modem multiple times produced exactly the same result. Another hour on hold with Optimum, back to the Optimum modem - back to 160 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: One gotcha you should know about
customer_reviews.text: This modem remembers the first device's MAC address (serial number), and any ignores other devices. So, when setting this up, I used my laptop, but when I tried to switch to my pfSense firewall, the firewall would not connect (DHCP failed). Power cycling the modem eventually worked. Hopefully that saves you time. It took me a few hours to realize this modem does not behave with standard expectations. Linux/BSD, I think, will release DHCP leases on shutdown, not sure if that would have worked. Been working flawlessly since. So, I can recommend it, so long as you know this quirk.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Waranowitz

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Successfully Working!
customer_reviews.text: This modem has restored my faith in our notoriously crummy cable company. We were paying to rent one of their modems that was causing internet speed issues and constant pixelation. This modem will pay for itself in under a year, it's half of the gurth of the one we were using and works 5x faster. I highly recommened this modem, it arrived quickly and installation was simple.
customer_reviews.author: JillHdz

customer_reviews.title: Great for new xfinity customers
customer_reviews.text: Our cable company was purchased by xfinity and we had the option of either renting a modem for $14 a month or providing our own modem. It was very hard to find a cheap modem with a decent speed. For a small family we only have 100 mbps service and this modem handles it easily. There is no issue for running Netflix, and two YouTube channels at the same time, the internet is still fast. The modem easily pays for itself in 3.5 months. So def worth it. Its also small, I don't know why newer modems are so huge.
customer_reviews.author: Rj

customer_reviews.title: Simple, painless, works great with Orbi!
customer_reviews.text: Charter/Spectrum told me that my old Arris modem was outdated. Rather than having them charge me to lease a new one I bought the Netgear CM600 - it's on Charter's approved list. Setup and authorization required a call to Charter/Spectrum, but that's no fault of Netgear. Works great with the new Orbi RBK50 system.
customer_reviews.author: Raybador

customer_reviews.title: SCAM ARTISTS
customer_reviews.text: Was fine for a few months then for some reason it stopped working. Not because of Cox, not my router. The MODEM. After calling tech support they tricked me into revealing my "90 day warranty" has expired and refuse to offer help unless I resubscribed for 40+ dollars. Screw that.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: TA freaking DA
customer_reviews.text: So this is the first time using a modem, didn’t want to bow down to the cable company and fork over 15 bucks for a modem router combo that doesn’t work. I spent 1month using the one from the cable co and It was a horrible experience. Last house had fiber, so I said he’ll let try a little DIY. Hooked the sucker up, called the cable co, Bada bing, bada boom, works as advertised, and just as good as my fiber back at my last house.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: a fine modem for 13 months, then failed to lock any downloading freqs.
customer_reviews.text: REVISED REVIEW AFTER 13 MONTHS OF OWNERSHIP: it's been a fine modem for 13 months, then it failed to lock any downloading freqs. Standard Warranty 12 months. To Netgear's credit, the warranty lookup says "Call us", as if some support or return might be possible. If I was a younger man then I might do that. Instead I fixed the problem with a different cablemodem. ORIGINAL REVIEW AFTER A WEEK OF OWNERSHIP: no problems that I can tell, other than I haven't figured out how to get to the management page.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Worth it on Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Huge improvements in speed. HUGE. The automatic website provisioning process failed through Comcast, but I was successfully able to get them to provision it via a phone call. It was a _slow_ phone call, but not the modem's fault. It's bee great on Comcast for weeks since. You wouldn't believe it was the same service. I was not getting anything near what I was paying for in speed before.
customer_reviews.author: TeaDragon

customer_reviews.title: Good value and saves money versus renting a modem
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any problems with this since hooking it up. I first used it with Time Warner Cable which has now become Spectrum so it's compatible with those providers. Setup was easy but I think I did have to call my internet provider and provide them with the id number for the device. It's capable of higher speeds than I currently subscribe to and was a decent price. We frequently have multiple devices streaming over our internet at a time and haven't had any issues. It saves money versus renting a modem.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous 321

customer_reviews.title: Sold still registered to Previous owner
customer_reviews.text: Now it works good...as expected. No where in the ad do I see Used and Refurbished...but this is exactly what this is. Once I hooked it up...I had to contact Xfinity who could not Activate the Modem because it was still registered to previous owner. They eventually contacted the owner and was able to get the release (hours later). So my review includes that it can be a major hassel
customer_reviews.author: batatokr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speed improvement over my old cable modem
customer_reviews.text: I've had an Arris cable modem since I got Internet about 12 years ago, and I was more or less satisfied with my speed. I was reading in PC Magazine about increasing speeds offered by cable companies so I thought it was time to upgrade. I got the Netgear cable modem since my wireless router is also Netgear. Talk about a speed increase! It's nearly as fast as my access at the office! Definitely worth the upgrade, and a great price too. You just have to call your Internet provider with the MAC number so they can authorize access. Took five minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P. Freese

customer_reviews.title: Excellent on Xfinity with voice (East Coast)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an older Arris modem to support 250MB service on xfinity. Used the self install and didn't have to call into support to switch it over. Within 30 min of disconnecting the old and putting this on, I was online with my number ported over to this unit and all is good. Recommend if using on xfinity with phone service to save on rental fees. Speeds are consistent and all has been great so far. Only downside is it doesn't have battery backup however seems many manufacturers are removing this deature however nothing a UPS cant handle if that a concern.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible speeds that was a breeze to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this modem. It was not hard to switch from my old modem. Much faster and more reliable. I have it paired with a Netgear AC1600 router for blazing speeds. CM600 is all you would need for ISP speeds of 300-400.
customer_reviews.author: David Gabriel  Caceres

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your cable provider approves this modem for telephone services (voip)
customer_reviews.text: We have Optimum ( cablevision). I was able to add this to my account but I couldn’t use my house phone off of it. The reason is cable companies have. A list of approved equipment and you can obtain that list from your cable company. This modem doesn’t work with optimum for home phone services. I learned the hard way. Dont get discouraged by the small list of providers the seller displays without doing your research first. Ive wasted enough time with that mistake .
customer_reviews.author: Zadrian Maciura

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: After doing lot of research I upgraded to the Netgear CM600. It was extremely easy to install and has been working perfectly for a couple of months. Total installation time was less than 30 minutes - even for a novice.
customer_reviews.author: Pt

customer_reviews.title: RECONDITIONED...THOUGHT IT WAS NEW
customer_reviews.text: We just tried to hook up this modem with our newly installed Comcast and found out this modem is remanufactured and still registered with the previous owner so can not use. The return deadline was yesterday and now stuck with a useless modem. They should make it clear it's reconditioned and if so, be sure it is not still registered to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Long

customer_reviews.title: Very basic modem
customer_reviews.text: I configured it with Xfinity, the config was relatively easy. My problem was in regards to the LAN side. There's Nothing in regards to LAN settings, that you can configure. You cannot tell if and what private IPs are getting assigned. I connected a little switch and tried to configure the range of private IPs to be assigned via DHCP, but no way to change that, or to know the range, what MAC addresses were seen, and things like that. It is pretty much a black box in that sense. Returned it, and for now, I'll use the Xfinity rented modem. It sucks to pay rent for a box, but config is certainly easier.
customer_reviews.author: Fede Andrade

customer_reviews.title: It would be better if it was the reverse
customer_reviews.text: Currently in use for nearly a month. Unit has 2 phone port but just one Ethernet port. It would be better if it was the reverse. Service provider charges add fee if second port requires a service phone line. All you would need is just one line wired into your home phone wiring after disconnecting the local phone provider. (eg. Verizon). Had to wait a month to get the unit due to back order. Phone voice quality is excellent through the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: adorable
customer_reviews.text: This little modem is adorable. It's so little. Did a speed test and I clocked in at 118 MBPS download and 14 up... I'm on a 100MBPS plan with time warner. Super simple to install TWC does everything...Updates the firmware and what not. Literally takes 10 minutes. Split the coaxil one goes to the existing modem (for phone) and the other do this modem. And call TWC. This item is alot smaller than I thought it would be... it fits easily on my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cea

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy For Wired Setup!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to hook this up to my brand new 4K Sony TV, and because it uses some kind of odd mac address the TV will not recognize it no matter what is done. I wasted hours and hours with tech trying to solve the problem, and so now if I want Ethernet hard line (WIFI is shown to have negative health effects), directly to the TV, too bad, no luck, gotta buy another modem. I should have bought the Aris SURFboard!
customer_reviews.author: R. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent speeds
customer_reviews.text: We have spectrum 200mbit service. This netgear 24x8 modem had difficult time providing constant speeds throughout the day. Would be fine during morning and day time but would slow to a crawl at night, down to single digit mbits. Spectrum tech came out and replaced it with new technicolor e31t2v1 32x8 modem and our speeds are back up to 200mbits at night times.
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item just before the virus started but was unable to get started with Xfinity till they just reopened. The voice side worked but the wifi I could not get my router to work with this modem. I have an Apple router and it worked great with my ATT but could not get it to work with this Netgear modem. It works with the modem I received from Xfinity I know its too late to return it but very disappointed with this item. Thanks to the virus I can't return so stuck just storing it in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Dutchman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hook and set up
customer_reviews.text: This modem is about 1/5 the size of the spectrum (formally Time Waner) cable companies cable modem. The great part is No more monthly $10.00 rental fee! It pays for itself in about 4 months of use and after that it's pure savings of $120.00 a year in rental fees. You will need to call your cable provider once you have hooked it up to deactivate their modem and activate your new Netgear modem normally only about a 10-minute process if the cable Company employee knows what they are doing. Just follow the simple directions that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: DALE

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this is lieu of paying the cable company ridiculous amounts of money to rent theirs. It was easy to set-up and has worked great. When I moved and had to change cable companies, I had no problems getting it up and running with the new cable company. I paired this with theand have had no issues at all. Highly recommend if you're looking to get your own modem.
customer_reviews.author: L. Long

customer_reviews.title: they weren't happy the next day when I returned their garbage box
customer_reviews.text: I refuse to pay Spectrum a $100 security deposit AND an additional $10 a month for 3 years+ to rent their ancient, behemoth modem, when I can pay $60-ish now for my own equipment. In one month they had to come THREE TIMES to "make adjustments" to their own darn equipment. Cable is such a scam! I set this baby up myself and got it activated with a phone call. Haha, they weren't happy the next day when I returned their garbage box, but they can't keep you from using your own gear! Got a refund for their $100 security deposit and this thing paid for itself on month 3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent modem, save yourself some cash and get this why pay your provider.
customer_reviews.text: We use Suddenlink as our provider and we chose to use the Netgear CM600 because it was on their compatible modem list. The modem is perfect although Suddenlink were a pain getting it activated on their network. Once setup and connected to our Netgear wireless router it has worked flawlessly. Much better than paying to rent a modem from our broadband provider
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for the leased modem
customer_reviews.text: When I decided to drop the phone service part of my Cox account, I wanted to buy a modem rather than lease equipment. After consulting the list of approved modems, I chose this one and it has worked perfectly. It's easy to set up without delay. As with any modem, it's wise to reset it and your router periodically just to "clear things out." My data speeds exceed those guaranteed under my particular plan and all the devices in our home are humming along nicely. The modem is connected to a Netgear Nighthawk AC 1750 router which I also recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Person to Person Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Online In No Time!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and be online in no time. I have Time Warner/Spectrum service provider. One phone call to them to remove their lease equipment and register this. **Be sure to moniter your service bill; the way they process it, you may have to contact them for refund of old lease amount for first month following registration of Netgear modem. Have had this 2 months with no problems at all. Saving $10+taxes every month on cable bill.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate NYer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago to replace the Comcast modem. Haven't had any issues with hardware. Funny how I ran into more issues with renting a modem from Comcast then just getting my own. Setup was relatively easy, minus setting it up with Comcast but that's typical customer support. Signal is great, glad I got it and saved like $100, it paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Hooberstank

customer_reviews.title: Netgear  Modem CM-400
customer_reviews.text: I like the model and the brand so much. That all week it's been tested out. At, first I thought with all the Mbps there's 340. I thought it would be bigger than my old one! I'm a believer that big things comes in small packages now. The modem is nice for the price I've received and I even purchased an additional warranty just in case, due to I have small children and they like lights and new things. So, far the product has done it's job and the speeds are more than enough for what I use it for. I love my new gadget or should I say device for the younger audience's?
customer_reviews.author: Dexter SC Farlough

customer_reviews.title: Modem great Xfinity sucks
customer_reviews.text: The modem is great. Comcast makes transitions difficult because it wants customers to rent a cable modem and pay the $14 a month for the rental. Return your Xfinity box and THEN call Xfinity to ping your new modem to fully activate it. I trouble shot my network for hours because I expected Xfinity to do its job. My mistake. I called them several times for them to activate the new modem and take the old modem from the Available Networks at my house. Modem is great. Xfinity is not.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Never exceeded speeds of approx 125mbps
customer_reviews.text: I’m subscribed to 500mbps from WOW! but this modem never reached consistent speeds beyond 125mbps even though it’s rated up to 900mbps+. I thought it was an issue with WOW! but a tech visit confirmed it was due to this modem. Defective? Maybe. It was returned and replaced with the CM1000 and speeds are consistently beyond 500mbps on wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Slower than expected? Check the type of Ethernet cable you’re using.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was fairly simple. Seems to work well in conjunction with a NetGear R6230 router. My main complaint is that this Gigabit modem (capable of up to 1000 Mbps) is supplied with a Cat 5 Ethernet cable (only capable of 100Mbps). For a few pennies more NetGear could easily have supplied a Cat 5e or Cat 6 cable.
customer_reviews.author: SRD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. Works with Wave broadband.
customer_reviews.text: I noticed other reviews say it didn't work with their Wave broadband cable internet. I'm not sure if they did something wrong, or perhaps it was Wave's fault and has since been improved, but this modem works perfectly with my high-speed cable internet from Wave. I it plugged into my separate Netgear router, and from there hard-lined into a smart TV, PS4, Alexa and a Tivo. Everything works great. Wifi speeds are pushing 250mb down and 10 up, which is what my service package quoted me. Plus its a good looking modem.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Cable Modem CM600
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Netgear cable modem to upgrade and also to avoid paying monthly rental charges for an inferior modem provided by TDS (Arris CM820A). The plug-in was simple and I had to call the cable company to activate the new modem. Simple process. The only issue that I came across was that this Netgear modem needs to standing up on its base and can not be placed flat because of the air vents. I did have to relocate the cables and connections to accommodate it.
customer_reviews.author: Dinesh Tyagi

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid and fast - but router may need to be reinstalled
customer_reviews.text: Got the Netgear CM600 after my old cable modem started to need daily reboots. Was easy to install (though I did need to call Spectrum), and the new cable modem has been rock solid since. But my 6 node Velop mesh router would not connect - had to do a factory reset and reinstall of the whole system. Interestingly, though, the Velop bandwidth improved - now getting the full 200 Mbps across our large house, while some far corners had been at 50, despite all my attempts at fine tuning placement and channels. Overall, I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: JLM

customer_reviews.title: Worked Good only for a day
customer_reviews.text: It worked as it should. Only for a day. Next day. Crawling internet bandwidth like a snail. From 350 Mbps went down to 3.5-0.35 Mbps. What I did for the day I used. Did my school work. Watched one 45 min episode SD quality. At least the ASUS CM-16 worked Good for a year. This lasted only 1 day. Please do a quality assurance and connection test before you release product for sale. Since, Spectrum (Time Warner) is offering free Modem rentals now. This product is an utter waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: dev

customer_reviews.title: Great product.. when it's not broken
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3td CM500V cable modem. Gladly,Comcast has made it incredibly easy to replace their $11/month modem.. however, I can't seem to make it past 1 year. Luckily, 60 minutes on the phone with Netgear allows me to RMA the old one for a new one. I always just keep one a spare. It's always the same problem when it does bad... The internet just stops working. Wish they would quit making landfill and start making something with quality. Just like every other electronic device.. cheap Chinese product made to increase American profits!
customer_reviews.author: Cory Mattson

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Netgear CM600 cable modem to replace a 5-year-old old Motorola that had seen better days. No trouble setting up the CM600: I plugged it in to just one computer, contacted the (Spectrum) cable company, gave them the MAC address (which had magically come up on a Web page on the connected computer), and a couple of minutes later, the modem was activated. I then plugged it in to my Netgear router (WNDR4300), and away I went. Two weeks so far, and not a glitch. Speed test showed I'm getting about 17% faster speed than what my cable plan says I should get, so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: HiJohn440

customer_reviews.title: Stop paying lease fees for a modem!  Get this one!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to buying my own modem so I could stop paying TWC $8 a month to use their equipment. I basically bought two of these during my time leasing their equipment - dumb! Install was easy - all it took was a 5 minute call with TWC and my network was up and running (there was no on-line registration process as the TWC website indicated for this model). Done several speed tests and no change in performance from the leased modem. I even clocked 25 Mbps a couple times (only paying for 20 Mbps service). Pros: easy setup, compact size makes easy to hide Cons: none
customer_reviews.author: daddyofthree

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it
customer_reviews.text: I've have Spectrum 100 Mbps service and bought this to future-proof myself as this modem is rated to a download speed 400 Mbps but, in reality, you should expect a max download speed of 300 Mbps. This modem has worked flawlessly for the last two years. Even though I recently had to upgrade my router to keep up with the demands of a "smarter" home and new 4K TV, I hope this modem lasts for 2-3 more years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement to help get the faster speeds comcast allows for
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to setup and worked great... I was getting 30-35mb/s and had comcast do a test on my previous modem and they said it was too old to get the faster speeds that were available... I picked this up and got it activated with Comcast... no longer paying $10/mo for their "old" modem, and now i'm enjoying 100mb/s service instantly with the change. The only downfall I'd say is with most bundles for comcast you get a voice/telephone line, and this modem doesn't have a way to hook up the voice line. Other than that it's been a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenster

customer_reviews.title: Save 120 a year and stop renting a modem
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, works perfectly and now I'm saving $120 a year instead of renting the modem from Cablevision (if you're going to supply someone with a service why make them rent the equipment necessary to get the service you provide? Like going to a dentist and getting charged to rent the drill... I hate Cablevision)
customer_reviews.author: Robert V.

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated !!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product in Jan and then it completely stopped working in June. I then used another modem and my internet was fine so it definitely was the Netgear modem. I called their 1888-638-4327 customer service number (in India) and was told they could not help me because they wanted me to help them trouble shoot the problem while having it plugged in. I repeated to them that the modem is NOT working at all....they refused to help me....Very Frustrated !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My before and after internet speeds are attached (download 0 ...
customer_reviews.text: My before and after internet speeds are attached (download 0.19mbps before, and 59.9 after). I'm in a one bedroom apartment and the internet has been really slow. I replaced the wireless modem with this wired modem + TP-Link AC1200 Wi-Fi Router + NETGEAR AC750 WiFi Range Extender. It has really sped up the connection, and now all my TVs, Echo Dots, Kindle, Thermostat, and phone connect with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: A. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and get functioning
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and get functioning. Took a few minutes longer than expected due to needing an update but still I'd say fifteen minutes including the call to spectrum. My kids can stream, we can be on tablets and or smartphones all at once without buffering, lag etc which is what the cable companies router/modem combo always did. I would highly recommend purchasing, it will pay for itself in months compared to the rental fee we had been paying.
customer_reviews.author: jenn mike

customer_reviews.title: Works with Xfinity Voice
customer_reviews.text: I only use this as a standalone voice modem so I can't speak for its internet usefulness but it works fine with Xfinity voice - easy to set up and a quick call to tech support had it up and running. I had to return an Arris model that was supposed to work with Xfinity but didn't (it may have been defective). Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Noah D. Karchmer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Time Warner Cable in Texas and i have the phone line that i never use...
customer_reviews.text: Works with Time Warner Cable in Texas and i have the phone line that i never use... The auto register web site didn't work not sure cause of time of day, 7pm, or whatever but the number provided was fast for cable company service... had me up and running through customer support in no time... I can already notice the speed difference and its not as hot as my old clunky unit they gave me... The 300 mbs is starting to show finally... And wanted to note the phone line the customer service stated will stop working but I never used it anyway so no harm no faul.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem in March and it worked fine at first. I suspect most positive reviewers wrote their reviews in these first few good months. Shortly thereafter, it just stopped being reliable. Every other day I'd wake up to no Wi-Fi and would have to manually reset the damn thing. I've since switched back to my older TP-Link modem and am now wondering why I ever bothered replacing it as it's given me no such issues (it was because I upgraded my internet speed and didn't want to overload my older modem's throughput -- big mistake). Avoid this modem if you can, as I'm now sitting on a $90 annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed G.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, very good value
customer_reviews.text: There were not a lot of choices for cable modems with VOIP capability and I opted for one of the less expensive units. I've had it now for about 3 months and have no complaints. The old cable modem supplied by Xfinity used to need to be reset at least once per week, had a lot of dropped connections, and high latency (according to my sons, the gamers). This one performs without any problems, does not need to be reset and is now saving me $10/month on my cable bill.
customer_reviews.author: J. Muri

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great value. Cable companies charge $10 a month for 'modem rental'. Went with the best modem could find, that Spectrum stated would be compatable (make sure you check with your ISP provider). The speed is better than with the cable company's modem and in 8 months it will make back it's purchase price and start to save money.
customer_reviews.author: Knipple S.

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Cable Modem CM600 - Compatible With All Cable Providers Including Xfinity by Comcast, Spectrum, Cox | For Cable Plans Up to 400 Mbps | DOCSIS 3.0
product_meta.description: Style:400Mbps Max Download| Pattern Name:SingleThe NETGEAR CM600 high speed Cable Modem provides a connection to high-speed cable Internet, up to 960Mbps -- 24 downstream & 8 upstream channels. It's Cable Labs DOCSIS 3. 0 certified to work with cable Internet providers XFINITY from Comcast, spectrum, Cox, Cablevision and more. Maximum rate is derived from DOCSIS 3. 0 Specifications and actual throughput will vary depending on the MSO provisioning and speed tier subscription. Check your cable Internet service provider web site for data speed tier compatibility. NETGEAR makes no Express or implied representations or warranties about this product's compatibility with any future standards. System requirements: Cable broadband Internet service, Please check your cable Internet service provider web site for data speed tier compatibility: Microsoft Windows 7, 8, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS, or other operating systems running a TCP/IP network, Microsoft Internet Explorer 5. 0, Firefox 2. 0, Safari 1. 4, or Google Chrome 11. 0 browsers or higher. : Memory: 8 MB NOR flash and 128 MB RAM.
feature_bullets: COMPATIBLE WITH ALL MAJOR CABLE INTERNET PROVIDERS: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast, COX, and Spectrum. NOT compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service.
SAVE MONTHLY RENTAL FEES: Model CM600 replaces your cable modem saving you up to $168/yr in equipment rental fees.
BUILT FOR FAST SPEED: Best for cable provider plans up to 400 Mbps speed.
WORKS WITH ANY WiFi ROUTER: Connect any WiFi router to this modem's Ethernet port to support all your wireless devices.
ETHERNET CONNECTIONS: 1 Gigabit Ethernet port connects to your computer or separate WiFi router.
MODEMHNOLOGY: Engineered with 24x8 channel bonding and DOCSIS 3.0.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars16,538 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
